title: riots actually commenting on our concerns with balance

replies.body: Still wondering who has the gigantic AP boner, as long as we're fielding balance questions.

I may just be oblivious to something, but is there a particular problem with the recent AP itemization change (outside of maybe Rylai's being a bit crazy)?

Or is it more a question of why AP itemization got adjustments before others (like AD or support itemization)?
Just compare Rylais to Frozen Mallet lol...then you know what's wrong with AP itemization.

Frozen Malet is bad on purpose, though, because if it was good, it would allow bruisers to keep their target slowed pretty much permanently unless they had hard disengage (DAE hate mobility creep?).

Rylai's passive is limited by spellcasts, which are gated by skillshot scope, range, cooldowns and mana.

Most mages can't though. There are only a few who have a Rylai's perma-slow - the DOT crowd (Cass, Malz) and the mega spam crowd (Cass, Eve), with weird ones like Kayle added on because her E is ridiculous. The vast majority of the roster cannot achieve anything close to a perma-slow, and have little use for a permanent slow considering constant application of the slow can burn entire mana pools and for the more bursty character (i.e. the majority of the roster), serves little purpose other than self-peel. I buy it on Syndra when I get a chance and use it only to keep people from chasing me with Qs, which is a pretty healthy use for the investment. Frozen Mallet on the other hand is a genuinely permanent slow, with no concerns such as mana drain, that is bought on a class that INTENDS to do sustained damage as a whole.

Rylai's has a few abuse cases on mages who can keep a genuinely permanent slow and have the sustained damage to make use of it, but Frozen Mallet has nothing BUT abuse cases because it's ALWAYS a permanent slow and everyone who buys it has the sustained damage to make use of it.

I always want to build Rylai's on {{champion:134}} but I just never seem to get around to it. CDR, movement speed, and mana/regen are just so important (and expensive). Not to mention having to rush some defense, especially in Devourer meta.

Syndra is kinda really frail too, since she isn't a Tear user (for Seraph's shield) or a RoA builder. The health from Rylai's gives you a little bit of breathing room when someone dives the backline in teamfights.

do you realize how difficult it is to fit rylai's into a typical ap mid build?

AP hits a lot more niches and combinations of offensive and defensive stats that just...falls short when looking at other categories. And has consistently done so since the game has launched (heck, we've had options removed!)

I can understand some of it (since just being able to right click dudes to death makes for boring games), but...feels bad, sometimes. Especially with MR being the way it is :S

Kits also come into it: Gettin' a little tired of the 100-0 AP carry packing teamwide CCs that ends with them going support over traditional support picks - and still being pretty functional, if not outright the superior option. That's just frustrating as a guy that plays the traditional supports.

and, thirdly, the apparent necessity of the burst assassin mage person having any CC whatsoever. That's just irritating to play against.

Granted I might also be biased.
